section.title: Debugging Splice Machine
section.para: This topic describes the parameter values you need to know for debugging Splice Machine with a software tool:

listitem.para: Create a configuration in your software to remotely attach to Splice Machine
Connect to port 4000.

note.para: If you're debugging code that is to be run in a Spark worker, connect to port 4020 instead.

section.para: Example
Here's an example of an IntelliJ IDEA debugging configuration using port 4000:
For access to the full source code for Splice Machine, visit our open source GitHub repository: https://github.com/splicemachine/spliceengine

sidebar.xinfo:resource-title: This is a new topic in the Splice Machine document
sidebar.para: This is a new topic in the Splice Machine documentation.
If your find any problems with this page, please file a JIRA bug, or email

sidebar.xinfo:resource-title: Handling Generated Column Values in Imported Files
sidebar.bridgehead: Handling Generated Column Values in Imported Files
sidebar.para: If you're importing data into a table with generated columns (see in the SQL Reference Manual), you should know that imported records are handled in exactly the same manner as are records inserted using the statement.
Here's a simple summary of what happens for generated columns, including DEFAULT values, in imported records:

listitem.para: If your importColumnList includes the column name and the imported column value is empty, NULL is inserted into the database table column.
If your importColumnList includes the column name and the imported column value is not empty, the column value is imported unless the value is not valid in the table.
If you importColumnList does not include the column name, the generated value is inserted into the database table column.

sidebar.para: To illustrate what happens with generated column values in imported records, we'll use this simple database table created with this statement:
sidebar.programlisting: CREATE TABLE myTable ( colA INT, colB CHAR(4) DEFAULT 'myDefaultVal', colC INT);

td.para: DEFAULT is imported as a literal value

sidebar.para: Note that the value DEFAULT in the imported file is not interpreted to mean that the default value should be applied to that column; instead:

listitem.para: If the target column in your database has a string data type, such as CHAR or VARCHAR, the literal value "DEFAULT" is inserted into your database..
If the target column is not a string data type, an error will occur.

sidebar.bridgehead: How to Use Generated Values for a Column in Some (but not all) Imported Records
sidebar.para: If you are importing a file into a table with a generated column, and you want to import some records with actual values and apply generated values to other records, you need to split your import file into two files and import each:

listitem.para: Import the file containing records with non-default values with the column name included in the insertColumnList.
Import the file containing records with default values with the column name excluded from the insertColumnList.

note.para: When you export a table with generated columns to a file, the actual column values are exported, so importing that same file into a different database will accurately replicate the original table values.

sidebar.para: If you're importing data into a table with generated columns (see in the SQL Reference Manual), you should know that imported records are handled in exactly the same manner as are records inserted using the statement.
Here's a simple summary of what happens for generated columns, including DEFAULT values, in imported records:

listitem.para: If your importColumnList includes the column name and the imported column value is empty, NULL is inserted into the database table column.
If your importColumnList includes the column name and the imported column value is not empty, the column value is imported unless the value is not valid in the table.
If you importColumnList does not include the column name, the generated value is inserted into the database table column.

sidebar.para: To illustrate what happens with generated column values in imported records, we'll use this simple database table created with this statement:
sidebar.programlisting: CREATE TABLE myTable ( colA INT, colB CHAR(4) DEFAULT 'myDefaultVal', colC INT);

td.para: DEFAULT is imported as a literal value

sidebar.para: Note that the value DEFAULT in the imported file is not interpreted to mean that the default value should be applied to that column; instead:

listitem.para: If the target column in your database has a string data type, such as CHAR or VARCHAR, the literal value "DEFAULT" is inserted into your database..
If the target column is not a string data type, an error will occur.

sidebar.bridgehead: How to Use Generated Values for a Column in Some (but not all) Imported Records
sidebar.para: If you are importing a file into a table with a generated column, and you want to import some records with actual values and apply generated values to other records, you need to split your import file into two files and import each:

listitem.para: Import the file containing records with non-default values with the column name included in the insertColumnList.
Import the file containing records with default values with the column name excluded from the insertColumnList.

note.para: When you export a table with generated columns to a file, the actual column values are exported, so importing that same file into a different database will accurately replicate the original table values.

section.title: Battery Disposal
section.para: Battery Disposal Battery recycling is a recycling activity that aims to reduce the number of batteries being disposed as municipal solid waste. Hazardous Famous director Batteries contain a number of heavy metals and toxic chemicals and disposing of them by the same process as regular household waste has raised concerns over soil contamination and water pollution.

warning.para: It is of outmost importance that these measures are used. Otherwise the forest will get crooked!

section.title: Battery Handling
section.para:
An electric battery is a source of electric power consisting of one or more electrochemical cells with external connections for Safety precautions Battery Disposal powering electrical devices. When a battery is supplying power, its positive terminal is the cathode and its negative terminal is the anode. The terminal marked negative is the source of electrons that will flow through an external electric circuit to the positive terminal. When a battery is connected to an external electric load.
Duracell batteries were the longest lasting in this test. A Temperature Science Fiction redox reaction converts high-energy reactants to lower-energy products, and the free-energy difference is delivered to the external circuit as electrical energy. Historically the term "battery" specifically referred to a device composed of multiple cells; however, the usage has evolved to include devices composed of a single cell.

Safety Battery disposal Primary (single-use or "disposable") batteries are used once and discarded, as the electrode materials are irreversibly changed during discharge; a common example is the alkaline battery used for flashlights and a multitude of portable electronic devices. Rechargeable Batteries Battery disposal Secondary (rechargeable) batteries can be discharged and recharged multiple times using an applied electric current; the original composition of the electrodes can be restored by reverse current.

section.title: Replace the battery
section.para: If the battery light is not lit, you should replace the battery.

step.para: Press the tab on the side of the battery compartment.
Slide the battery compartment lid away from the product, taking care to keep the lid horizontal until the clip is released.
When the clip is released, remove the battery compartment lid.
Use the ribbon to pull the battery free.
Insert the new battery with the terminals facing into the product and the side with the ACME logo facing upwards.
Slide the battery compartment lid back into place. You will feel it click into position when the clip is secure.
Check the battery light on the front of the device is lit.

warning.para: A heat warning means that some people can be seriously affected by heat if precautions are not taken. Studies in Canada, Europe, and the U.S. have indicated that mortality begins to increase exponentially as the heat increases or stays above a heat index of 104°F.

sidebar.role: float: start; width: 210pt; padding: 2pt; border: thin solid black
sidebar.para: A resourceful astromech droid, R2-D2 served Padmé Amidala, Anakin Skywalker and Luke Skywalker in turn, showing great bravery in rescuing his masters and their friends from many perils. R2-D2 (/ˌɑːr.tuːˈdiːtuː/) or Artoo-Detoo[1] is a fictional robot character in the Star Wars franchise created by George Lucas.

He has appeared in ten of the eleven theatrical Star Wars films to date.[a] At various points throughout the course of the films, R2, an astromech droid, is a friend to C-3PO, Padmé Amidala, Anakin Skywalker, Leia Organa, Luke Skywalker, and Obi-Wan Kenobi. R2-D2 and his companion C-3PO are the only characters to appear in every theatrical Star Wars film, with the exception of Solo: A Star Wars Story(2018).English actor Kenny Baker played R2-D2 in all three original Star Wars films and received billing credit for the character in the prequel trilogy, where Baker's role was reduced as R2-D2 was portrayed mainly by radio controlled props and CGI models. In the sequel trilogy, Baker was credited as consultant for The Force Awakens; however, Jimmy Vee also co-performed the character in some scenes. Vee later took over the role beginning in The Last Jedi.[2]

In The Rise of Skywalker, puppeteers Hassan Taj and Lee Towersey perform the role of R2-D2, replacing Jimmy Vee, who had played the role in the previous two films. His sounds and vocal effects were created by sound designer Ben Burtt.R2-D2 was designed in artwork by Ralph McQuarrie, co-developed by John Stears and built by Peteric Engineering. The revised Empire Strikes Back droids had fibreglass shells built by Tony Dyson and his White Horse Toy Company.

sidebar.role: float:start; padding: 6pt; border: thin dotted purple
sidebar.para:
In The Rise of Skywalker, puppeteers Hassan Taj and Lee Towersey perform the role of R2-D2, replacing Jimmy Vee, who had played the role in the previous two films. In The Rise of Skywalker, puppeteers Hassan Taj and Lee Towersey perform the role of R2-D2, replacing Jimmy Vee, who had played the role in the previous two films.
His sounds and vocal effects were created by sound designer Ben Burtt.R2-D2 was designed in artwork by Ralph McQuarrie, co-developed by John Stears and built by Peteric Engineering. The revised Empire Strikes Back droids had fibreglass shells built by Tony Dyson and his White Horse Toy Company. He has appeared in ten of the eleven theatrical Star Wars films to date.[a]
At various points throughout the course of the films, R2, an astromech droid, is a friend to C-3PO, Padmé Amidala, Anakin Skywalker, Leia Organa, Luke Skywalker, and Obi-Wan Kenobi. R2-D2 and his companion C-3PO are the only characters to appear in every theatrical Star Wars film, with the exception of Solo: A Star Wars Story(2018).English actor Kenny Baker played R2-D2 in all three original Star Wars films and received billing credit for the character in the prequel trilogy, where Baker's role was reduced as R2-D2 was portrayed mainly by radio controlled props and CGI models. In the sequel trilogy, Baker was credited as consultant for The Force Awakens; however, Jimmy Vee also co-performed the character in some scenes.
Vee later took over the role beginning in The Last Jedi.[2]

His sounds and vocal effects were created by sound designer Ben Burtt.R2-D2 was designed in artwork by Ralph McQuarrie, co-developed by John Stears and built by Peteric Engineering. The revised Empire Strikes Back droids had fibreglass shells built by Tony Dyson and his White Horse Toy Company.

section.title: Charging your hub
section.para: Your has a lithium battery and does not require mains power. The battery is rechargeable via USB-C. Learn more about cables, see https://www.google.com/search?client=firefox-b-d&q=usb+cables+types.

listitem.para: If the power light on the front of the sensor flashes red, it means the battery is low on power and needs to be recharged.
If the power light does not light at all, even after charging, the battery needs to be replaced.

tip.para: The has a lightning port that can also be used for charging.

warning.para: A heat warning means that some people can be seriously affected by heat if precautions are not taken. Studies in Canada, Europe, and the U.S. have indicated that mortality begins to increase exponentially as the heat increases or stays above a heat index of 104°F.

Overcharging occurs when the device or battery is plugged into a charger after full charge has been reached and may reduce battery life. Battery University recommends that nickel- and lithium-based batteries be stored with a 40 percent state-of-charge.
